symbols.name: File issues

children.docstring: The PHP SDK has a handwritten set of core files and a folder of autogenerated models. These models are generated using the [MSGraph SDK Code Generator
children.name: How the library is built

children.docstring: You can view the [README](https://github.com/microsoftgraph/MSGraph-SDK-Code-Generator/blob/master/README.md) for a full run-through of its capabiliti
children.name: How the generator works

children.docstring: Generation happens as part of a manual process that occurs once a significant change or set of changes has been added to the Graph. This may include:
children.name: When new features are added to the library

symbols.docstring: If you are making documentation changes, feel free to submit a pull request against the **master** branch. All other pull requests should be submitted
symbols.name: Pull requests

symbols.docstring: If you want to play around with the PHP library, you can get up and running quickly with the [PHP Connect Sample](https://github.com/microsoftgraph/ph
symbols.name: Get started with the PHP Connect Sample

symbols.docstring: You can install the PHP SDK with Composer, either run `composer require microsoft/microsoft-graph`, or edit your `composer.json` file:
symbols.name: Install the SDK

children.docstring: Register your application to use the Microsoft Graph API using [Microsoft Azure Active Directory](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_Regist
children.name: Register your application

children.docstring: The Microsoft Graph SDK for PHP does not include any default authentication implementations. The [`thephpleague/oauth2-client`](https://github.com/the
children.name: Authenticate with the Microsoft Graph service

children.name: Debug

children.docstring: This SDK has an XDebug run configuration that attaches the debugger to VS Code so that you can debug tests.
children.name: Debug tests on Windows
